tit.e: Mido Kanpakuki (A record of Mido regent)
Mido Kanpakuki (Diary of a Mido Regent)
tit.cmt: I feel that "Diary of a Mido Regent" is perhaps a more natural translation here. A search on Google reveals numerous hits for "diary" also.
tit.e: Mido Kanpakuki (Diary of a Mido Regent)

sen.j: 御堂関白記（みどうかんぱくき）は、平安時代の貴族の摂政太政大臣藤原道長が著した日記。
sen.e: Mido Kanpakuki is a diary written by FUJIWARA no Michinaga, a court noble who held titles of Regent and Grand Minister in the Heian period.
Mido Kanpakuki is a diary written by FUJIWARA no Michinaga, a court noble who held the titles of Regent and Grand Minister in the Heian period.
Mido Kanpakuki is a diary written by FUJIWARA no Michinaga, a court noble who held the titles of Regent and Grand Minister in the Heian period.

sen.j: 『入道殿御暦』・『御堂御記』・『法城寺摂政記』とも言う。
sen.e: It is also called "Priest's calendar," "Mido records," and "A Record of Hojoji Regent."
It is also called Priest's Calendar, Mido Records, and Diary of a Hojoji Regent.
sen.cmt: Capitalised titles and changed "record" to "diary" as above. Took titles out of quotation marks.
sen.e: It is also called "Priest's Calendar," "Mido Records," and "Diary of a Hojoji Regent."

sen.j: 国宝に指定されている。
sen.e: It was designated as a national treasure.
It is designated as a national treasure.
It is designated as a national treasure.

sen.j: 御堂関白記の名称由来は、藤原道長建立の法成寺無量寿院のことを指している。
sen.e: The name of Mido Kanpakuki came from the Hojoji Muryojuin Hall, which FUJIWARA no Michinaga built.
The name of Mido Kanpakuki came from the Hojoji Muryojuin Hall, which FUJIWARA no Michinaga built.
The name of Mido Kanpakuki came from the Hojoji Muryojuin Hall, which FUJIWARA no Michinaga built.

sen.j: しかし、道長は生前、一度として関白となっておらず、御堂関白記の名称は後世付けられたものであり、正確なものではない。
sen.e: However, Michinaga had never been a regent in his life, and Mido Kanpakuki was named by the posterity therefore it is quite doubtful about the title.
However, Michinaga never formally took the title of regent, so it is likely that the diary was merely titled Diary of a Mido Regent for posterity.
sen.cmt: This sentence contradicts the one above that states he held the title of regent somewhat, but I reworded it to read more naturally and be a bit less confusing.
sen.e: However, Michinaga never formally took the title of regent, so it is likely that the diary was merely titled Diary of a Mido Regent for posterity.

sen.j: 御堂関白記は藤原道長の日記史料として著名であるが、同時に意味不明な文章や、誤字、文法的誤りの多いことでも有名で、解釈が難しい史料である。
sen.e: Mido Kanpakuki is well known as a historical material of diary written by FUJIWARA no Michinaga, but at the same time it got a bad reputation for its unclear writings, misspellings, and grammatical errors, which make it difficult to be interpreted.

Mido Kanpakuki is well known as a diary of historical material written by FUJIWARA no Michinaga, but at the same time it has a bad reputation for unclear writing, misspellings, and grammatical errors, which make interpretation difficult.
sen.cmt: Changed "historical material of diary" to "diary of historical material". Corrected tense of "got" to "has", changed "its unclear writings" to "unclear writing" and changed "make it diffuclt to be interpretated" to "make interpretation difficult", all to make the sentence read more naturally and smoothly.
sen.e: Mido Kanpakuki is well known as a diary of historical material written by FUJIWARA no Michinaga, but at the same time it has a bad reputation for unclear writing, misspellings, and grammatical errors, which make interpretation difficult.

sen.j: これは同じ藤原摂関家の藤原忠実による『殿暦』、藤原師通による『後二条師通記』にもいえることで、摂関家は漢文についてそれほど得意ではなかったようだ。
sen.e: This can be applied to "Denryaku" written by FUJIWARA no Tadazane of the regent house of Fujiwara and "Gonijo Moromichi-ki" by FUJIWARA no Moromichi, so the regent family seem not to have been good at Chinese.

This can also be applied to Denryaku written by FUJIWARA no Tadazane of the regent house of Fujiwara and Gonijo Moromichi-ki by FUJIWARA no Moromichi, so it seems that the regent family were not particularly adapt at Classical Chinese.
sen.cmt: Took title out of quotation marks. Added "also" to "be applied" to make it a bit smoother. Wrote "not particularly adept at" to try to get the nuance of 「それほど」 and added "Classical" to "Chinese" for the translation of 「漢文」
sen.e: This can also be applied to "Denryaku" written by FUJIWARA no Tadazane of the regent house of Fujiwara and "Gonijo Moromichi-ki" by FUJIWARA no Moromichi, so it seems that the regent family were not particularly adapt at Classical Chinese.

sen.j: これにくらべ、同時期の藤原行成『権記』、藤原実資『小右記』はすぐれた文体と内容で定評がある。
sen.e: Compared with them, the contemporary works "Gonki" by FUJIWARA no Yukinari and "Shoyuki" by FUJIWARA no Sanesuke are well known for their excellent writing and contents.
Compared with them, the contemporary works Gonki by FUJIWARA no Yukinari and Shoyuki by FUJIWARA no Sanesuke are well known for their excellent writing and contents.
sen.cmt: Took titles out of quotation marks.
sen.e: Compared with them, the contemporary works "Gonki" by FUJIWARA no Yukinari and "Shoyuki" by FUJIWARA no Sanesuke are well known for their excellent writing and contents.

sen.j: 長徳4年（998年）から治安 (元号)元年（1021年）までの記述であるが、一部欠巻もある。
sen.e: The entries of the diary cover from 998 to 1021, though some of them are missing.
The diary entries cover the years 998 to 1021, though some of them are missing.
sen.cmt: Changed "entries of the diary" to "diary entries" to be more succinct, and changed "from" to "the years".
sen.e: The diary entries cover the years 998 to 1021, although some of them are missing.

sen.j: しかし欠巻分は抄録などで補填できるため、大部は参観できる。
sen.e: But the missing parts can be supplemented by excerpts, so it is possible to read most of them.
But the missing parts can be supplemented by excerpts, so it is possible to read most of them.
But the missing parts can be supplemented by excerpts, so it is possible to read most of them.

sen.j: しかし、道長は日記記述を行わなかった時期があるため、肝心の政治的動向や思惑が記されていることはまずあり得ない。
sen.e: As Michinaga didn't keep a diary for a certain period of time, his political attitude and intention, which we would like to know most, couldn't have been written in it.
As there were periods of time when Michinaga didn't keep a diary, not all of the crucial issues of his political attitudes and intentions could have been written in it.
sen.cmt: Tried to rewrite to read more fluidly. I added "not all of the" to try to make the sentence make a bit more sense. Changed "which we would like to know most" to a more succinct "crucial issues".
sen.e: As there were periods of time when Michinaga didn't keep a diary, not all of the crucial issues of his political attitudes and intentions could have been written in it.

sen.j: 驚くほど簡明な記録であり、現代人が期待するような内面的叙述は一切存在しない。
sen.e: The record is surprisingly simple, and there is no description of his feelings which we expect to read.
The diary is surprisingly simple, and lacks the emotional commentary which the modern reader would expect to find.
sen.cmt: Changed "record" to "diary" to fit above translations. I thought "emotional commentary" worked a bit better than the slightly clumsy "descriptions of feelings". Changed "there is" to "there are". I thought "modern reader" was a more accurate translation of 「現代人」 in this context so I used that.
sen.e: The diary is surprisingly simple, and lacks the emotional commentary which the modern reader would expect to find.

sen.j: ただ、藤氏長者の職掌を知り、活動範囲を学ぶには最適な史料であるといえよう。
sen.e: However, it could be the best historical material to know the official duties and field of activity of the head of the To family.
However, it could be the best historical material we have to understand the official duties and fields of activity of the head of the To family.
sen.cmt: Added "we have" and replaced "know" with "understand" to read a bit more naturally. Also corrected "field" to "fields"
sen.e: However, it could be the best historical material we have to understand the official duties and fields of activity of the head of the To clan.

sen.j: また、七曜に基づく曜日が記されていることでも知られる。
sen.e: It is also known for recording days of the week based on the seven-day system.
It is also known for recording days of the week based on the seven-day system.
It is also known for recording days of the week based on the seven-day system.

sen.j: 自筆本十四巻が現存している。
sen.e: There exists 14-volume of books written in his own handwriting.
14 volumes of books exist written in his own handwriting.
sen.cmt: Cut "there". Changed "volume" to "volumes". I also removed the hyphen.
sen.e: 14 volumes of books exist written in his own handwriting.

sen.j: 現代語訳は日本語では行われておらず、フランスの日本学学者がフランス語でしたものが唯一。
sen.e: A Japanese modern translation has not been made yet, but a Japanologist in France translated it into French, which is an only modern translation.
A modern Japanese translation has not been made yet, and the only existing modern translation is the French one made by a French Japanologist.
sen.cmt: Reworded the sentence to make it read a bit smoother. Changed "Japanese modern translation" to "modern Japanese translation" to read more naturally, and added "existing" to "only "to make it a little smoother. Pity we aren't given the Japanologist's name!
sen.e: A modern Japanese translation has not been made yet, and the only existing modern translation is the French one made by a French Japanologist.
